source.name: Token Standards: ERC-20 vs ERC-721
source.instructions: Which of the following statements correctly compare ERC-20 and ERC-721 token standards? Select all that apply.

answers.answer: ERC-20 tokens are fungible, while ERC-721 tokens are non-fungible
ERC-721 tokens represent unique assets, while ERC-20 tokens are interchangeable
ERC-20 tokens can be divided into smaller units, but ERC-721 tokens cannot
ERC-721 tokens are always more valuable than ERC-20 tokens
Both ERC-20 and ERC-721 tokens can represent ownership of physical assets

source.guidance: This question assesses understanding of the differences between ERC-20 and ERC-721 token standards. The correct options highlight key distinctions: ERC-20 tokens are fungible and interchangeable, while ERC-721 tokens are non-fungible and represent unique assets. ERC-20 tokens can be divided into smaller units, which is not possible for ERC-721 tokens without losing their uniqueness. Both standards can be used to represent ownership of physical assets through tokenization. The incorrect option addresses a common misconception: the value of tokens depends on various factors, not just the standard used. This question encourages critical thinking about the nature and applications of different token standards in blockchain ecosystems.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT compare and contrast the characteristics of ERC-20 and ERC-721 token standards in blockchain technology
